item.title: High-Dimensional Probability
item.description: This file is for the notes and exercises for the book High-Dimensional Probability Errata and update of the book: errata, update. Exercises solns reference: soln. 0. Appetizer Key Takeaways convex combination $\sum_{i=1}^m \lambda_i z_i \quad$ where $\quad \lambda_i \geq 0 \quad$ and $\quad \sum_{i=1}^m \lambda_i=1$. convex hull of a set $T$, $\mathrm{conv}(T):={ \text{convex combinations of } z_1, \cdots, z_m \in T \text{ for }m \in \mathbb{N}}$. Theorem 0.0.1 (Caratheodory’s Theorem): Every point in the convex hull of a set $T\subseteq \mathbb{R}^n$ can be expressed as a convex combination of at most $n+1$ points from $T$.
